natural problem:
Let $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}$ be vectors such that
\[\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}.\]Find
\[\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}.\]
natural solution: Since $\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}$ is the projection of $\mathbf{v}$ onto $\mathbf{w},$ $\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}$ is a scalar multiple of $\mathbf{w}.$  Therefore, \[\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix} = \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}}.\]

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes v w proj :: "real^2 \<Rightarrow> real^2"
assumes h0 : "proj w v = vector [7, -2]"
shows  "proj w (vector [7, -2]) = vector [7, -2]"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}$ be vectors such that
\[\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}.\]Find
\[\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}.\] The final Answer is \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}
 ### Proof
 Since $\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}$ is the projection of $\mathbf{v}$ onto $\mathbf{w},$ $\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}$ is a scalar multiple of $\mathbf{w}.$  Therefore, \[\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix} = \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes v w proj :: "real^2 \<Rightarrow> real^2"
assumes h0 : "proj w v = vector [7, -2]"
shows  "proj w (vector [7, -2]) = vector [7, -2]"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: If the projection of vector v onto vector w is [7, -2], then the projection of the vector [7, -2] onto vector w is also [7, -2].

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes v w :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "proj w v = (\<lambda>_. 7) - (\<lambda>_. 2)"
shows  "proj w ((\<lambda>_. 7) - (\<lambda>_. 2)) = (\<lambda>_. 7) - (\<lambda>_. 2)"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $\mathbf{v}$ and $\mathbf{w}$ be vectors such that
\[\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}.\]Find
\[\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}.\] The final Answer is \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}
 ### Proof
 Since $\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}$ is the projection of $\mathbf{v}$ onto $\mathbf{w},$ $\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}$ is a scalar multiple of $\mathbf{w}.$  Therefore, \[\operatorname{proj}_{\mathbf{w}} \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix} = \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -2 \end{pmatrix}}.\]
 *)

theorem
fixes v w :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "proj w v = (\<lambda>_. 7) - (\<lambda>_. 2)"
shows  "proj w ((\<lambda>_. 7) - (\<lambda>_. 2)) = (\<lambda>_. 7) - (\<lambda>_. 2)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem: If the projection of vector v onto vector w equals the constant function 7 minus the constant function 2, then show that the projection of the constant function 7 minus the constant function 2 onto vector w is also the constant function 7 minus the constant function 2.
